title: Book of Deuteronomy
summary: The Book of Deuteronomy (literally "second law" from Greek deuteros + nomos[1]) is the fifth book of the Torah, where it is called Devarim (Hebrew: דְּבָרִים‎), "the words [of Moses]", and the fifth book of the Christian Old Testament, where it is also known as the Fifth Book of Moses.[2]
